q:
You have users and accounts, on which you perform CRUD operations. You are hosting the application locally on port 8080. You have designed the following endpoints. Which is the correct request URI's to delete the user with id: 141 and accounts with id: 231?
Code

app.delete("/users/:id",function(req,res){
   //some code
})
app.delete("/accouts/:id",function(req,res){
   //some code
})
Which of the following is the correct statement about the PATCH Method?

a.option: It necessarily changes the state of the server every time we fire the request.
It is cacheable and hence partial information would be cached.
It updates and overrides the entire representation every time.
It is idempotent and hence, not safe.

q: Suppose your application consists of 4 buttons namely: GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE. As the user clicks on any one of these, the respective request is sent to the server with a set of request data. Now, if a user continuously clicks a button multiple times and a request is being sent each time, clicking on which of these buttons would not result in redundancy of data at the server?

You want to use the Entity Framework Code First API to pass a SQL query directly to the database.
Which of the following methods can you use if the return type is an entity?

a.option: Any of the above can be used

q:
You are using the code snippet given alongside to route your Web API when working with ASP.Net 4.x. What type of routing does the config.MapHttpAttributeRoutes() method enable in the given context?

public static class WebApiConfig
{
 public static void Register(HttpConfiguration config)
 {
 config.MapHttpAttributeRoutes();
 config.Routes.MapHttpRoute(
 name: "DefaultApi",
 routeTemplate: "api/{controller}/{id}",
 defaults: new { id = RouteParameter.Optional }
 );
 }
}

You are creating a web API using ASP.NET on your computer system. You are defining a binding source attribute, requesting a query string parameter. What can you use in place of XXX to complete the procedure of defining the binding source attribute?

[HttpGet]
public ActionResult<List<Product>> Get(
 XXX
{
 List<Product> products = null;

 if (discontinuedOnly)
 {
 products = _productsInMemoryStore.Where(p => p.IsDiscontinued).ToList();
 }
 else
 {
 products = _productsInMemoryStore;
 }

 return products;
}
